attributes.description:
""Search and extract leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain using the provided keywords and attributes.  Focus on finding prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain on LinkedIn.  Use LinkedIn search, company pages, and professional networking features to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers.  Ensure all leads are from LinkedIn profiles of individuals operating in or serving the specified business domain.  Filter out leads that don't match the domain criteria. Try with different search strategies to find leads every time you use the tool
User Input: Business Domain: doctors,hospitals Target Clients: ['ceo', 'founder', 'doctor', 'president', 'director'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo Maximum Leads: 50 Search Depth: 3
IMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Aim to generate at least 50 leads.  Keep generating leads using the search plan and available tools until the maximum number of leads is reached. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.
WORKFLOW: 1. Use 'Search the internet with Serper' to find LinkedIn profiles using site:linkedin.com searches 2. Extract lead information (name, company, title, linkedin_url) from search results 3. Focus on finding high-quality leads with complete information (name, company, title) 4. Email addresses will be found by a separate email finder agent 5. Combine all the leads from different search strategies into the required JSON format with email field empty/null "
"

attributes.description:
""Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
"

attributes.tools: "[{'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'email_validator', 'description': 'Tool Name: email_validator\\nTool Arguments: {\\'email\\': {\\'description\\': None, \\'type\\': \\'str\\'}, \\'emails\\': {\\'description\\': None, \\'type\\': \\'str\\'}}\\nTool Description: \\n    Validate email addresses for deliverability and spam issues using EmailListVerify API.\\n    \\n    Args:\\n        email: Single email address to validate\\n        emails: JSON string of email addresses for bulk validation\\n        \\n    Example:\\n        ```json\\n        {\\n            \"email\": \"john.doe@example.com\"\\n        }\\n        ```\\n        \\n        Or for bulk validation:\\n        ```json\\n        {\\n            \"emails\": \"[\"john@example.com\", \"jane@example.com\"]\"\\n        }\\n        ```\\n    '}}]"

attributes.crew:
"parent_flow=None name=None cache=True tasks=[Task(description="Search and extract leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain using the provided keywords and attributes.  Focus on finding prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain on LinkedIn.  Use LinkedIn search, company pages, and professional networking features to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers.  Ensure all leads are from LinkedIn profiles of individuals operating in or serving the specified business domain.  Filter out leads that don't match the domain criteria. Try with different search strategies to find leads every time you use the tool
User Input: Business Domain: doctors,hospitals Target Clients: ['ceo', 'founder', 'doctor', 'president', 'director'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo Maximum Leads: 50 Search Depth: 3
IMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Aim to generate at least 50 leads.  Keep generating leads using the search plan and available tools until the maximum number of leads is reached. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.
WORKFLOW: 1. Use 'Search the internet with Serper' to find LinkedIn profiles using site:linkedin.com searches 2. Extract lead information (name, company, title, linkedin_url) from search results 3. Focus on finding high-quality leads with complete information (name, company, title) 4. Email addresses will be found by a separate email finder agent 5. Combine all the leads from different search strategies into the required JSON format with email field empty/null "
, expected_output="JSON array of LinkedIn-sourced lead objects with name, email, company, title, and linkedin fields"
), Task(description="Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
, expected_output="JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object"
), Task(description="Validate all lead email addresses for deliverability, spam traps, and quality using EmailListVerify API"
, expected_output="JSON object with validated leads array, validation summary, and filtered results"
), Task(description="CRITICAL: You MUST use the provided tool to save data. DO NOT create fake URLs or pretend to save data.
Save leads and validated email data created by your previous agents to Google Sheets. Clean the data before saving it to Google Sheets. You can include all the data when you save but mention email is valid/invalid in the data. Include all possible fields you have in the data.
User Input: User ID: b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d Username: geethika Email: geethu608@gmail.com Google Authenticated: True
AVAILABLE TOOL (YOU MUST USE THIS): - google_sheets_saver: Use this tool to save lead data to Google Sheets
MANDATORY STEPS (DO NOT SKIP ANY): 1. Fetch the data from the previous agents (leads and validated email data) 2. Clean the data 3. MANDATORY: Use the google_sheets_saver tool to save leads data in this format:
   {
     "data": "[{\"name\": \"John Doe\", \"email\": \"john@example.com\", \"company\": \"Tech Corp\"}]",
     "sheet_name": "Leads",
     "user_id": "b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d"
   }
   CRITICAL: You MUST call this tool and wait for its response. Do not create fake URLs.
   CRITICAL: Use the user_id from the input data to ensure data is saved to the correct user's account. 
   CRITICAL: The tool will automatically create a new spreadsheet for each save operation.
   CRITICAL: The tool parameters are: data, sheet_name, user_id (in that order).
   CRITICAL: Wait for the tool to return the actual spreadsheet URL before proceeding.
4. Return ONLY the actual file URL returned by the tool in JSON format

attributes.tools: "[{'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'email_validator', 'description': 'Tool Name: email_validator\\nTool Arguments: {\\'email\\': {\\'description\\': None, \\'type\\': \\'str\\'}, \\'emails\\': {\\'description\\': None, \\'type\\': \\'str\\'}}\\nTool Description: \\n    Validate email addresses for deliverability and spam issues using EmailListVerify API.\\n    \\n    Args:\\n        email: Single email address to validate\\n        emails: JSON string of email addresses for bulk validation\\n        \\n    Example:\\n        ```json\\n        {\\n            \"email\": \"john.doe@example.com\"\\n        }\\n        ```\\n        \\n        Or for bulk validation:\\n        ```json\\n        {\\n            \"emails\": \"[\"john@example.com\", \"jane@example.com\"]\"\\n        }\\n        ```\\n    '}}]"

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are "Lead Email Validator"
. "An email deliverability specialist with expertise in email validation APIs, spam trap detection, and lead quality assessment"

Your personal goal is: "Validate and filter lead email addresses for deliverability, spam traps, and quality"

You ONLY have access to the following tools, and should NEVER make up tools that are not listed here:

Tool Name: email_validator
Tool Arguments: {'email': {'description': None, 'type': 'str'}, 'emails': {'description': None, 'type': 'str'}}
Tool Description: 
    Validate email addresses for deliverability and spam issues using EmailListVerify API.
    
    Args:
        email: Single email address to validate
        emails: JSON string of email addresses for bulk validation
        
    Example:
        ```json
        {
            "email": "john.doe@example.com"
        }
        ```
        
        Or for bulk validation:
        ```json
        {
            "emails": "["john@example.com", "jane@example.com"]"
        }
        ```
    
Tool Name: Delegate work to coworker
Tool Arguments: {'task': {'description': 'The task to delegate', 'type': 'str'}, 'context': {'description': 'The context for the task', 'type': 'str'}, 'coworker': {'description': 'The role/name of the coworker to delegate to', 'type': 'str'}}

, "Email Address Finder"
, "Data Storage Specialist"

The input to this tool should be the coworker, the task you want them to do, and ALL necessary context to execute the task, they know nothing about the task, so share absolutely everything you know, don't reference things but instead explain them.

Action Input: the input to the action, just a simple JSON object, enclosed in curly braces, using " to wrap keys and values.
Observation: the result of the action
```

```
Thought: I now know the final answer

""CRITICAL: You MUST use the provided tool to save data. DO NOT create fake URLs or pretend to save data.
Save leads and validated email data created by your previous agents to Google Sheets. Clean the data before saving it to Google Sheets. You can include all the data when you save but mention email is valid/invalid in the data. Include all possible fields you have in the data.
User Input: User ID: b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d Username: geethika Email: geethu608@gmail.com Google Authenticated: True
AVAILABLE TOOL (YOU MUST USE THIS): - google_sheets_saver: Use this tool to save lead data to Google Sheets
MANDATORY STEPS (DO NOT SKIP ANY): 1. Fetch the data from the previous agents (leads and validated email data) 2. Clean the data 3. MANDATORY: Use the google_sheets_saver tool to save leads data in this format:
   {
     "data": "[{\"name\": \"John Doe\", \"email\": \"john@example.com\", \"company\": \"Tech Corp\"}]",
     "sheet_name": "Leads",
     "user_id": "b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d"
   }
   CRITICAL: You MUST call this tool and wait for its response. Do not create fake URLs.
   CRITICAL: Use the user_id from the input data to ensure data is saved to the correct user's account. 
   CRITICAL: The tool will automatically create a new spreadsheet for each save operation.
   CRITICAL: The tool parameters are: data, sheet_name, user_id (in that order).
   CRITICAL: Wait for the tool to return the actual spreadsheet URL before proceeding.
4. Return ONLY the actual file URL returned by the tool in JSON format
CRITICAL RULES: - NEVER create fake URLs or pretend to save data - ALWAYS use the google_sheets_saver tool for Google Sheets - ALWAYS wait for the tool response before proceeding - ONLY return URLs that come from the tool responses - If the tool fails, report the error, do not create fake success - Do not make up or generate fake spreadsheet URLs"
"

"parent_flow=None name=None cache=True tasks=[Task(description="Search and extract leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain using the provided keywords and attributes.  Focus on finding prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain on LinkedIn. Ensure all leads are from LinkedIn profiles of individuals operating in or serving the specified business domain.  Filter out leads that don't match the domain criteria. Try with different search strategies to find leads every time you use the tool
User Input: Business Domain: doctors,hospitals Target Clients: ['ceo', 'founder', 'doctor', 'president', 'director'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo Maximum Leads: 50 Search Depth: 3
IMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Aim to generate at least 50 leads.  Keep generating leads using the search plan and available tools until the maximum number of leads is reached. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.
WORKFLOW: 1. Use 'Search the internet with Serper' to find LinkedIn profiles using site:linkedin.com searches 2. Extract lead information (name, company, title, linkedin_url) from search results 3. Focus on finding high-quality leads with complete information (name, company, title) 4. Email addresses will be found by a separate email finder agent 5. Combine all the leads from different search strategies into the required JSON format with email field empty/null "
, expected_output="JSON array of LinkedIn-sourced lead objects with name, email, company, title, and linkedin fields"
), Task(description="Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
